issue.title: 1485 schedule campaign complete
issue.body:
Added functionality to schedule campaign completion. Also added the ability to set completed_date via API and New Campaign web interface. To assist users in know when the completion's are scheduled the quick stat shows the completion date when after launch date. The completion date will also be displayed in the results page when the campaign is not completed and the date is after the launch date. 

I have run multiple tests using both API and Web GUI with consistent results. Multiple tests have also been added to the tests files.

If approved I will then take a look to update documentation showing these changes.

issue.title: Email sent twice to some of the recipients and landing page stopped working for some time
issue.body:
What version of Gophish are you using?: 
0.7.1 (This would probably be 0.8)

Brief description of the issue: 
I noticed a few issues, not just one and mentioned below. The target list contained 33K email IDs and the campaign landing page had a login page to check who submitted the data.
- Campaign Stopped sending emails after sending 12K emails out of 33K but the campaign continued running. I had to create another campaign to deliver the rest of the emails. 
- Landing Page did not open in the browser for a long period of time, probably due to high load but it continued the tracking. Gophish service was running between 100 to 200% CPU. When load reduced then only landing page opened in the browser.
- The campaign sent emails twice to some of the recipients, not to the entire target list.
- Few Misc issues such as - Gophish service stopped once and landing page configuration page pointed to the old domain used in the past campaign.

What are you expecting to see happen? :
- The campaign must deliver emails to the uploaded list of targets, should not stop after sending a few emails.
- Landing page should open in the browser despite the high cpu load, not sure if this caused it though)
- The campaign should not send an email twice. The email sent twice to 5% of people out of total people. 

What are you seeing happen?
Same as mentioned in the brief description.

If this question is related to email templates or landing pages not working as expected, please provide your template or landing page below:

```html
Insert code here
```

Please provide any terminal output that may be relevant below:

```
Insert output here
```

Please provide as many steps as you can to reproduce the problem:
 * Step 1 - 
 * Step 2 -

issue.title: email reporting error:  "imap: unexpected completion status ... The specified charset is not supported"
issue.body:
What version of Gophish are you using?:
Gophish-v0.9 on linux
IMAP Email on Exchange 2016

Brief description of the issue:
In 'Reporting Settings' I put in all the details, left advanced settings alone. I click 'Test Settings' and get a nice big green checkmark. 

So what is the end user supposed to do to get a successful report? In my testing I have tried forwarding, replying (with the To address changed) and sending as attachment to the configured imap account. Gophish dashboard is not reporting a successful report.

comment.body:
With Gmail, I use the following settings:

Host: imap.gmail.com
Port: 993
Use TLS: true

I also turned on "Less secure app access" to allow connections via IMAP.

issue.title: SSLtest indicated SSL 3 support from server
issue.body:
**Thanks for reaching out! We're happy to help resolve issues as quickly as possible.**

**Please use this template when creating a new issue. If you do not follow this template format, your issue may be closed without comment.**

Before filing a new issue, please use the search bar at the top of the browser to search for similar issues. Also, please make sure you have read our [documentation](https://getgophish.com/documentation/), which covers how to use Gophish.

What version of Gophish are you using?: 0.80 running on Windows 2016

Brief description of the issue: Scan of https site from https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest indicated SSL v3 support. Alert from scan "This server is vulnerable to the POODLE attack. If possible, disable SSL 3 to mitigate. "  I have followed all advisories for Windows to disable SSL 3 support. The server is a fresh install with no other extra roles/features installed. Only Gophish v0.8 is installed. SSL certificate is purchased from GoDaddy and works fine. How can I disable SSL v3 so it doesn't pop up in the scan again?

What are you expecting to see happen? : 

What are you seeing happen?

If this question is related to email templates or landing pages not working as expected, please provide your template or landing page below:

```html
Insert code here
```

Please provide any terminal output that may be relevant below:

```
Insert output here
```

Please provide as many steps as you can to reproduce the problem:
 * Step 1 - Scan the external https site from https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest
 * Step 2 - Report produced indicated "This server is vulnerable to the POODLE attack. If possible, disable SSL 3 to mitigate. "

issue.title: SSLtest indicated SSL 3 support from server
issue.body:
**Thanks for reaching out! We're happy to help resolve issues as quickly as possible.**

**Please use this template when creating a new issue. If you do not follow this template format, your issue may be closed without comment.**

Before filing a new issue, please use the search bar at the top of the browser to search for similar issues. Also, please make sure you have read our [documentation](https://getgophish.com/documentation/), which covers how to use Gophish.

What version of Gophish are you using?: 0.80 running on Windows 2016

Brief description of the issue: Scan of https site from https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest indicated SSL v3 support. Alert from scan "This server is vulnerable to the POODLE attack. If possible, disable SSL 3 to mitigate. "  I have followed all advisories for Windows to disable SSL 3 support. The server is a fresh install with no other extra roles/features installed. Only Gophish v0.8 is installed. SSL certificate is purchased from GoDaddy and works fine. How can I disable SSL v3 so it doesn't pop up in the scan again?

What are you expecting to see happen? : 

What are you seeing happen?

If this question is related to email templates or landing pages not working as expected, please provide your template or landing page below:

```html
Insert code here
```

Please provide any terminal output that may be relevant below:

```
Insert output here
```

Please provide as many steps as you can to reproduce the problem:
 * Step 1 - Scan the external https site from https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest
 * Step 2 - Report produced indicated "This server is vulnerable to the POODLE attack. If possible, disable SSL 3 to mitigate. "

comment.body:
I'm not sure how you got this result (is Gophish running behind a proxy?) but I'm almost 100% positive Gophish doesn't support SSLv3 and isn't vulnerable to Poodle.

As of https://github.com/gophish/gophish/commit/79e680e67587848da20964b2173e95e12c4d0a7f we only support TLS 1.1 and 1.2. But even before that, SSLv3 has been disabled in Go's TLS implementation for a long time (always?) - you can see https://github.com/golang/go/issues/32716 for more info.

Without more troubleshooting information, I'm afraid there isn't anything I can do to replicate this issue.

issue.title: imap: command not allowed in the current state
issue.body:
What version of Gophish are you using?: 
Gophish-v0.9
Brief description of the issue: 
not able to setup the imap account detials for report settings.

Have the following error at the terminal when setting the imap account.
```
imap: command not allowed in the current state
```
for the below imap setting:
````
Host          : imap.mail.yahoo.com
port           : 993
username  :  ******@yahoo.com
password  : *****
````
And when i change the email-id whithout the "@yahoomail.com"
````
username  : ****
````
I get the following error.
```
imap: unexpected completion status ("NRXHC3 BAD [CLIENTBUG] SELECT Command is not valid in this state")
```

comment.body: yes i get the same error.

issue.title: Hover over URL change.
issue.body:
This is more of a question than an issue, but is there a way to make the {{.URL}} tag say something different when hovered over in an email client?

i.e when it's hovered over, instead of saying "http://mygophishserver/....." could we have it say "http://alegitwebsite.com/......"? The RID can stay, that's not an issue.

I thought about a DNS redirect but we have remote users who's phones etc won't grab the DNS redirect...

issue.title: Hover over URL change.
issue.body:
This is more of a question than an issue, but is there a way to make the {{.URL}} tag say something different when hovered over in an email client?

i.e when it's hovered over, instead of saying "http://mygophishserver/....." could we have it say "http://alegitwebsite.com/......"? The RID can stay, that's not an issue.

I thought about a DNS redirect but we have remote users who's phones etc won't grab the DNS redirect...

comment.body:
No, you can't change the URL the browser shows when you hover over it. This isn't an ethical security reason, it's just a security reason. You can imagine the implications if this were possible!

This is enforced by the browser, and there isn't anything we can do to change it. When you hover over a link, the browser will always show you what the link actually points to.

issue.title: Would restarting a Gophish service impact the running campaign?
issue.body:
Hi Team,

If I restart a Gophish service, would it impact the running campaign?
I am targetting 33K recipients and all of sudden the phishing link (used for the landing page stopped working - it says page can not be displayed) and I am halfway through sending out the emails. 

Would a restart help? And, would it impact the emails that are about to be delivered and campaign?

Appreciate all your help and support!

comment.body:
Likely not.  I have restarted the service multiple times while a campaign is running but the volume is low.
What OS are you running this on? You should be able to check the listeners and ensure they are listening on 80 or 443 depending on your config.

issue.title: Hover over URL change.
issue.body:
This is more of a question than an issue, but is there a way to make the {{.URL}} tag say something different when hovered over in an email client?

i.e when it's hovered over, instead of saying "http://mygophishserver/....." could we have it say "http://alegitwebsite.com/......"? The RID can stay, that's not an issue.

I thought about a DNS redirect but we have remote users who's phones etc won't grab the DNS redirect...

comment.body: This is likely not possible from within Gophish due to "ethical security" reasons I believe.

issue.title: email reporting error:  "imap: unexpected completion status ... The specified charset is not supported"
issue.body:
What version of Gophish are you using?:
Gophish-v0.9 on linux
IMAP Email on Exchange 2016

Brief description of the issue:
In 'Reporting Settings' I put in all the details, left advanced settings alone. I click 'Test Settings' and get a nice big green checkmark. 

So what is the end user supposed to do to get a successful report? In my testing I have tried forwarding, replying (with the To address changed) and sending as attachment to the configured imap account. Gophish dashboard is not reporting a successful report.

comment.body:
Thanks for your patience with this @ldunzweiler. I've only tested the IMAP reporting on GMail and my own IMAP servers; so I'm not sure how Exchange handles things.

Are there exchange servers I could connect to, or just sign up for an Outlook.com email address to try replicate your environment? I'd be pressed for time to setup a whole Exchange server.

As for your error `imap: unexpected completion status ("STBGR2 NO [ALERT] Please log in via your web` - I got this too, and signed in via the web link and authorised the 'less secure' app. It seems you've done this, but GMail works fine for me.

I'm quite busy with my day job at the moment but will try figure this out ASAP.

Did you have to import the Exchange IMAP Server's cert to your gophish server to get your TLS connection working?

issue.title: How is email reporting supposed to work?
issue.body:
What version of Gophish are you using?:
Gophish-v0.9 on linux
IMAP Email on Exchange 2016

Brief description of the issue:
In 'Reporting Settings' I put in all the details, left advanced settings alone. I click 'Test Settings' and get a nice big green checkmark. 

So what is the end user supposed to do to get a successful report? In my testing I have tried forwarding, replying (with the To address changed) and sending as attachment to the configured imap account. Gophish dashboard is not reporting a successful report.

comment.body:
> Do you need to import the Exchange IMAP Server's cert to your gophish server? I have a similar gophish set up, but I was unable to get a successful connection from "Test Settings". The error message in log says "tls: first record does not look like a TLS handshake".
> 
> I am using TLS for IMAP.
> 
> What version of Gophish are you using?:
> Gophish-v0.9 on Windows 10
> IMAP Email on Exchange 2016

IMAP port is 143
IMAPS port is 993

If I have "Use TLS:" checked when using port 143 I get that exact error. You using port 993?

comment.body:
Do you need to import the Exchange IMAP Server's cert to your gophish server?  I have a similar gophish set up, but I was unable to get a successful connection from "Test Settings".  The error message in log says "tls: first record does not look like a TLS handshake".

I am using TLS for IMAP.

What version of Gophish are you using?:
Gophish-v0.9 on Windows 10
IMAP Email on Exchange 2016
